intro: Chaetostoma pungens var. brachycarpum, commonly known as the short-fruited spiny hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Its fruit is small and capsule-like, giving it the "short-fruited" descriptor in its botanical name. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
